monster.name: Anteka

action.name: Hoof Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) damage.

action.name: Charge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) damage.
Anteka must move 15 feet or more towards its target to use this attack.

environment: snowy mountains, tundra, arctic ridge, hoarfrost reach, guiding lands, frost islands, yilufa snowy mountains, glacial valley

monster.name: Apceros

action.name: Tail Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) damage.

action.name: Duck
entries: Apceros ducks into its shell, making it immune to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing. It cannot take any actions or move while ducking.

environment: old desert, old volcano, desert, volcano, dunes, wildspire waste, guiding lands, gorge, white lake, thunderous sands, moonlands, ghost rune volcanoes, monsonne plains, trese desert, alcala

monster.name: Aptonoth

action.name: Tail Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) damage.

reaction.name: Flee
entries: Upon taking damage, Aptonoth will groan in pain, alerting nearby Aptonoth to the danger, causing them and the surrounding Aptononth to be feared, dashing away from the source of danger.

environment: forest and hills, old jungle, old swamp, snowy mountains, jungle, swamp, great forest, tower, deserted island, sandy plains, flooded forest, volcano (3rd), ancestral steppe, sunken hollow, everwood, verdant hills, marshlands, ruined pinnacle, ancient forest, guiding lands, hermit forest, esther lake, ancestral tomb, pondry hills, perennial pass, hakolo island

monster.name: Barnos

trait.name: Acid Spit
entries: The Barnos can cast acid splash at will. It only counts as a first level spellcaster. If a Barnos' acid splash hits, the target's armor is broken, causing them to take a -2 penalty to AC (or +2 to being attacked) until they spend a non combat activity to fix it.

environment: great ravine, everstream, elder's recess, guiding lands

monster.name: Gajau

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) damage.

environment: flooded forest, ancient forest, wildspire waste, shrine ruins, flooded forest (rise), frost islands, lava caverns

action.name: Head Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Lunge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) damage.
Upon a hit, target must make a {@dc 13} constitution saving throw. On a fail, they are {@condition paralyzed} until the start of the Girros' next turn.
Monsters that are known to attack in packs, using the deadly vapor of the Rotten Vale to their advantage. They are known for crippling targets with their paralyzing fangs.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

Upon hitting a creature, make a contested athletics check. If the creature fails, the Great Jagras swallows them, causing them to be {@condition grappled}, and they take a {@damage 1d6} acid damage at the beginning of each turn.

action.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@atk mw} Great Jagras whips the area in front or behind him in a 10 ft. cone. {@hit 5} to hit to each creature in the radius, dealing ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgenoning damage to each.

legendary.name: Swallow
entries: When the Great Jagras fails a check, they can choose to succeed instead; however, when they do, they must swallow a medium or lower sized creature next to them, swallowing them and causing them to take a -5 penalty to movement speed and -1 penalty to AC until the creature is disgested.

From the Monster's Diary on the Great Jagras: "This fucking freak. Good god. If you think its goons are annoying, you havent seen this guy gobble up your entire picnic. It may be large, but its still mortal. A fire weapon will really knock this thing out of the park. Don't let it near an Aptonoth, youre not going to like what you see."

monster.name: Jagras

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., two targets. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

environment: ancient forest, guiding lands, shrine ruins, flooded forest (rise)

entries: From the Hunter's Diary excerpt on Jagras: "These stupid fucking lizards are a pain in the ass. jagras or, whatever, really. i was never really one to care for small monsters. always hitting me right when im about to do something important. kill as fast as possible"

monster.name: Kelbi

trait.name: Aggressive Stillness
entries: Any creatures that stand still while being noticed by a Kelbi for more than one minute will be attacked by the Kelbi.

action.name: Hoof Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage.

action.name: Charge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) damage.
Kesotdon must move in a straight line 15 feet or longer before being able to use this attack.

Kesotdon must move in a straight line 15 feet or longer before being able to use this attack.

monster.name: Kulu-Ya-Ku
actionHeader: Kulu-Ya-Ku has multiattack. They can do two Pecks, or a Peck and a Rock Bash.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Rock Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Rock Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) damage.
When Kulu-Ya-Ku hits a player with this attack, the entity hit by the attack must make a {@dc 15} constitution save. If they fail, they are {@condition stunned} for their next turn.

bonus.name: Scout
entries: Kulu-Ya-Ku searches for a rock if they lost it, doing a {@dc 13} perception check so long as they are in a region where such is applicable.

legendaryHeader: The Kulu-Ya-Ku can use their legendary action, so long as they have a rock in hand.

legendary.name: Legendary Resistance
entries: Kulu-Ya-Ku uses its rock to succeed on a saving throw. If the saving throw is physical, it physically manipulates the rock in a way that allows it to succeed, and if the saving throw is mental, it bashes the rock against its head, causing it snap out of any trance or magical restrictions. Doing so causes the rock to break, and they must Scout for a new one.

environment: ancient forest, wildspire waste, guiding lands, shrine ruins, sandy plains (rise), flooded forest (rise), lava caverns, jungle (mhrs)

monster.name: Mosswine

action.name: Snuffle
entries: Mosswine uses his Big Nose to sniff for mushrooms, using his perception to roll for it.

action.name: Head Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

environment: forest and hills, old jungle, old swamp, jungle, swamp, great forest, verdant hills, marshlands, ancient forest, wildspire waste, rotten vale, gorge, highland, flower field, painted waterfalls, dawnwind valley, hermit forest, kumbel wetlands, dark veil forest, esther lake, ancestral tomb, ghost rune volcanoes, firefly mountain stream

monster.name: Popo

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Charge
entries: The Popo charges at a target, charging towards it and maiming it with both its tusks and hooves. The Popo must use its full movement to use this attack.
{@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Call
entries: Upon taking damage, the Popo will cry out in pain, alerting other Popo to its presence and rallying them to fight alongside it. This restores any feared condition the other Popo had at the time.

environment: snowy mountains, tundra, frozen seaway, arctic ridge, hoarfrost reach, frost islands, clamorous ridge, yilufa snowy mountains, glacial valley, darj snowfields
